info.title: Geocoder REST API
info.description: This API computes the physical locations (i.e., latitude and longitude) and correct, standardized forms of civic and non-civic addresses in British Columbia.

get.description: Represents the set of geocoded and standardized sites and intersections whose address best matches a given query address.

parameters.name: outputFormat
parameters.description: Results format. See outputFormat

parameters.name: addressString
parameters.description:
Examples: 525 Superior Street, Victoria, BC
301-780 Blanshard St, Victoria, BC
Johnson St and Government St, Victoria, BC.
Civic or intersection address as a single string. See addressString

parameters.name: locationDescriptor
parameters.description: Describes the nature of the address location. See locationDescriptor

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of search results to return.

parameters.name: interpolation
parameters.description: accessPoint interpolation method. See interpolation

parameters.name: echo
parameters.description: If true, include unmatched address details such as site name in results.

parameters.name: setBack
parameters.description: The distance to move the accessPoint away from the curb and towards the inside of the parcel (in metres). Ignored if locationDescriptor not set to accessPoint.

parameters.name: outputSRS
parameters.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

parameters.name: minScore
parameters.description: The minimum score required for a match to be returned. See minScore

parameters.name: matchPrecision
parameters.description: Example: street,locality. A comma separated list of individual match precision levels to include in results. See matchPrecision

parameters.name: matchPrecisionNot
parameters.description: Example: street,locality. A comma separated list of individual match precision levels to exclude from results. See matchPrecisionNot

parameters.name: siteName
parameters.description: A string containing the name of the building, facility, or institution (e.g., Duck Building, Casa Del Mar, Crystal Garden, Bluebird House).See siteName

parameters.name: unitDesignator
parameters.description: The type of unit within a house or building. See unitDesignator

parameters.name: unitNumber
parameters.description: The number of the unit, suite, or apartment within a house or building.

parameters.name: unitNumberSuffix
parameters.description: A letter that follows the unit number as in Unit 1A or Suite 302B.

parameters.name: civicNumber
parameters.description: The official number assigned to a site by an address authority. See civicNumber

parameters.name: civicNumberSuffix
parameters.description: A letter or fraction that follows the civic number (e.g., the A in 1039A Bledsoe St). See civicNumberSuffix

parameters.name: streetName
parameters.description: The official name of the street as assigned by an address authority (e.g., the Douglas in 1175 Douglas Street). See streetName

parameters.name: streetType
parameters.description: The type of street as assigned by a municipality (e.g., the ST in 1175 DOUGLAS St). See streetType

parameters.name: streetDirection
parameters.description: The abbreviated compass direction as defined by Canada Post and B.C. civic addressing authorities. See streetDirection

parameters.name: streetQualifier
parameters.description: Example: the Bridge in Johnson St Bridge. The qualifier of a street name. See streetQualifier

parameters.name: localityName
parameters.description: The name of the locality assigned to a given site by an address authority. See localityName

parameters.name: provinceCode
parameters.description: The ISO 3166-2 Sub-Country Code. The code for British Columbia is BC.

parameters.name: localities
parameters.description: A comma separated list of locality names that matched addresses must belong to. For example, setting localities to Nanaimo only returns addresses in Nanaimo

parameters.name: notLocalities
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of localities to exclude from the search.

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description: Example: -126.0792945083648,49.76287332290923,-126.0163386310997,49.79077056256354 . A bounding box (xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax) that limits the search area. See bbox

parameters.name: centre
parameters.description: Example: -124.0165926,49.2296251 . The coordinates of a centre point (x,y) used to define a bounding circle that will limit the search area. This parameter must be specified together with 'maxDistance'. See centre

parameters.name: maxDistance
parameters.description: The maximum distance (in metres) to search from the given point.  If not specified, the search distance is unlimited.

parameters.name: extrapolate
parameters.description: If true, uses supplied parcelPoint to derive an appropriate accessPoint. See extrapolate

parameters.name: parcelPoint
parameters.description: The coordinates of a point (x,y) known to be inside the parcel containing a given address. See parcelPoint

200.description: A list of matching sites or intersections and their physical locations. See addresses response

get.description: Represents the set of occupants whose addresses best match a given query address. Every occupant has an associated site which has a standardized address and a coordinate location on the Earth.

parameters.name: outputFormat
parameters.description: Results format. See outputFormat

parameters.name: addressString
parameters.description:
Examples: Redfish Elementary --
Redfish Elementary -- Balfour
Redfish Elementary School -- 265 Bryan Rd, Balfour, BC
Occupant name followed by a frontGate delimiter ('--') followed by an optional address

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description:
Example: schools;courts;employment
A list of tags separated by semicolons.

parameters.name: locationDescriptor
parameters.description: Describes the nature of the address location. See locationDescriptor

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of search results to return.

parameters.name: interpolation
parameters.description: accessPoint interpolation method. See interpolation

parameters.name: echo
parameters.description: If true, include unmatched address details such as site name in results.

parameters.name: setBack
parameters.description: The distance to move the accessPoint away from the curb and towards the inside of the parcel (in metres). Ignored if locationDescriptor not set to accessPoint.

parameters.name: outputSRS
parameters.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

parameters.name: minScore
parameters.description: The minimum score required for a match to be returned. See minScore

parameters.name: matchPrecision
parameters.description: Example: street,locality. A comma separated list of individual match precision levels to include in results. See matchPrecision

parameters.name: matchPrecisionNot
parameters.description: Example: street,locality. A comma separated list of individual match precision levels to exclude from results. See matchPrecisionNot

parameters.name: siteName
parameters.description: A string containing the name of the building, facility, or institution (e.g., Duck Building, Casa Del Mar, Crystal Garden, Bluebird House).See siteName

parameters.name: unitDesignator
parameters.description: The type of unit within a house or building. See unitDesignator

parameters.name: unitNumber
parameters.description: The number of the unit, suite, or apartment within a house or building.

parameters.name: unitNumberSuffix
parameters.description: A letter that follows the unit number as in Unit 1A or Suite 302B.

parameters.name: civicNumber
parameters.description: The official number assigned to a site by an address authority. See civicNumber

parameters.name: civicNumberSuffix
parameters.description: A letter or fraction that follows the civic number (e.g., the A in 1039A Bledsoe St). See civicNumberSuffix

parameters.name: streetName
parameters.description: The official name of the street as assigned by an address authority (e.g., the Douglas in 1175 Douglas Street). See streetName

parameters.name: streetType
parameters.description: The type of street as assigned by a municipality (e.g., the ST in 1175 DOUGLAS St). See streetType

parameters.name: streetDirection
parameters.description: The abbreviated compass direction as defined by Canada Post and B.C. civic addressing authorities. See streetDirection

parameters.name: streetQualifier
parameters.description: The qualifier of a street name (e.g., the Bridge in Johnson St Bridge)

parameters.name: localityName
parameters.description: The name of the locality assigned to a given site by an address authority. See streetDirection

parameters.name: provinceCode
parameters.description: The ISO 3166-2 Sub-Country Code. The code for British Columbia is BC.

parameters.name: localities
parameters.description: A comma separated list of locality names that matched addresses must belong to. For example, setting localities to Nanaimo only returns addresses in Nanaimo

parameters.name: notLocalities
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of localities to exclude from the search.

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description: Example: -126.0792945083648,49.76287332290923,-126.0163386310997,49.79077056256354 . A bounding box (xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax) that limits the search area. See bbox

parameters.name: centre
parameters.description: Example: -124.0165926,49.2296251 . The coordinates of a centre point (x,y) used to define a bounding circle that will limit the search area. This parameter must be specified together with 'maxDistance'. See centre

parameters.name: maxDistance
parameters.description: The maximum distance (in metres) to search from the given point.  If not specified, the search distance is unlimited.

parameters.name: extrapolate
parameters.description: If true, uses supplied parcelPoint to derive an appropriate accessPoint. See extrapolate

parameters.name: parcelPoint
parameters.description: The coordinates of a point (x,y) known to be inside the parcel containing a given address. See parcelPoint

200.description: A list of matching occupants, sites, and their physical locations. Response document will contain one About Query Representation and one Site Address Representation plus Occupant Representation for each matching occupant.

get.description: Represents the site nearest a given point

parameters.name: outputFormat
parameters.description: Results format. See outputFormat

parameters.name: point
parameters.description: Example: -122.377,50.121 Centre point of search. See point

parameters.name: maxDistance
parameters.description: The maximum distance (in metres) to search from the given point.  If not specified, the search distance is unlimited.

parameters.name: outputSRS
parameters.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

parameters.name: locationDescriptor
parameters.description: Describes the nature of the address location. See locationDescriptor

parameters.name: setBack
parameters.description: The distance to move the accessPoint away from the curb and towards the inside of the parcel (in metres). Ignored if locationDescriptor not set to accessPoint.

200.description: The nearest site in Site Address Representation

get.description: Represents the closest occupant to a given point

parameters.name: outputFormat
parameters.description: Results format. See outputFormat

parameters.name: point
parameters.description: Example: -122.377,50.121  The point (x,y) from which the nearest site will be identified. The coordinates must be specified in the same SRS as given by the 'outputSRS' parameter.

parameters.name: maxDistance
parameters.description: The maximum distance (in metres) to search from the given point.  If not specified, the search distance is unlimited.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description:
Example: schools;courts;employment
A list of tags separated by semicolons.

parameters.name: outputSRS
parameters.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

parameters.name: locationDescriptor
parameters.description: Describes the nature of the address location. See locationDescriptor

parameters.name: setBack
parameters.description: The distance to move the accessPoint away from the curb and towards the inside of the parcel (in metres). Ignored if locationDescriptor not set to accessPoint.

200.description: The nearest occupant in Site Address Representation plus Occupant Representation

get.description: Represents the closest intersection to a given point

parameters.name: outputFormat
parameters.description: Results format. See outputFormat

parameters.name: point
parameters.description: Example: -122.377,50.121  The point (x,y) from which the nearest site will be identified. The coordinates must be specified in the same SRS as given by the 'outputSRS' parameter.

parameters.name: maxDistance
parameters.description: The maximum distance (in metres) to search from the given point.  If not specified, the search distance is unlimited.

parameters.name: outputSRS
parameters.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

parameters.name: minDegree
parameters.description: The minimum degree an intersection can have to be included in results. A dead-end has a degree of 1.

parameters.name: maxDegree
parameters.description: The maximum degree an interesection can have to be included in results. A four-way stop has a degree of 4.

200.description: The nearest intersection in Intersection Address Representation

get.description: Represents sites near a given point in the order of closest to farthest

parameters.name: outputFormat
parameters.description: Results format. See outputFormat

parameters.name: point
parameters.description: Example: -122.377,50.121  The point (x,y) from which the nearby sites will be identified. The coordinates must be specified in the same SRS as given by the 'outputSRS' parameter.

parameters.name: maxDistance
parameters.description: The maximum distance (in metres) to search from the given point.  If not specified, the search distance is unlimited.

parameters.name: outputSRS
parameters.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of search results to return.

parameters.name: locationDescriptor
parameters.description: Describes the nature of the address location. See locationDescriptor

parameters.name: setBack
parameters.description: The distance to move the accessPoint away from the curb and towards the inside of the parcel (in metres). Ignored if locationDescriptor not set to accessPoint.

200.description: A list of selected sites that are near a given point in order of closest to farther. Each site in the response document is structured as a Site Address Representation

get.description: Represents occupants near a given point in order of closest to farthest

parameters.name: outputFormat
parameters.description: Results format. See outputFormat

parameters.name: point
parameters.description: Example: -122.377,50.121  The point (x,y) from which the nearest site will be identified. The coordinates must be specified in the same SRS as given by the 'outputSRS' parameter.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description:
Example: schools;courts;employment
A list of tags separated by semicolons.

parameters.name: maxDistance
parameters.description: The maximum distance (in metres) to search from the given point.  If not specified, the search distance is unlimited.

parameters.name: outputSRS
parameters.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of search results to return.

parameters.name: locationDescriptor
parameters.description: Describes the nature of the address location. See locationDescriptor

parameters.name: setBack
parameters.description: The distance to move the accessPoint away from the curb and towards the inside of the parcel (in metres). Ignored if locationDescriptor not set to accessPoint.

200.description: A list of selected occupants that are near a given point in order of closest to farther. Each occupant is returned as a Site Address Representation plus a Occupant Representation

get.description: Represents intersections near a given point

parameters.name: outputFormat
parameters.description: Results format. See outputFormat

parameters.name: point
parameters.description: Example: -122.377,50.121  The point (x,y) from which the nearest site will be identified. The coordinates must be specified in the same SRS as given by the 'outputSRS' parameter.

parameters.name: maxDistance
parameters.description: The maximum distance (in metres) to search from the given point.  If not specified, the search distance is unlimited.

parameters.name: outputSRS
parameters.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of search results to return.

parameters.name: minDegree
parameters.description: The minimum degree an intersection can have to be included in results. A dead-end has a degree of 1.

parameters.name: maxDegree
parameters.description: The maximum degree an interesection can have to be included in results. A four-way stop has a degree of 4.

200.description: A list of selected intersections near a given point. Each intersection is in Intersection Address Representation

get.description: Represents sites within a given area

parameters.name: outputFormat
parameters.description: Results format. See outputFormat

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description: Example: -119.51,49.48,-119.53,49.50. A bounding box (xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax) used to limit the search area. See bbox

parameters.name: outputSRS
parameters.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of search results to return.

parameters.name: locationDescriptor
parameters.description: Describes the nature of the address location. See locationDescriptor

parameters.name: setBack
parameters.description: The distance to move the accessPoint away from the curb and towards the inside of the parcel (in metres). Ignored if locationDescriptor not set to accessPoint.

200.description: A list of selected sites within a given area. Each site in the response document is structured as a Site Address Representation

parameters.name: bbox

parameters.name: outputFormat
parameters.description: Results format. See outputFormat

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description: Example: -119.51,49.48,-119.53,49.50. A bounding box (xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax) used to limit the search area. See bbox

parameters.name: outputSRS
parameters.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

parameters.name: maxResults

parameters.name: minDegree
parameters.description: The minimum degree an intersection can have to be included in results. A dead-end has a degree of 1.

parameters.name: maxDegree

200.description: A list of selected intersections within the given area. Each intersection is in Each intersection is in Intersection Address Representation

parameters.name: siteID
parameters.description: A unique, but not immutable, site identifier.

parameters.name: outputFormat
parameters.description: Results format. See outputFormat

parameters.name: outputSRS
parameters.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

parameters.name: locationDescriptor
parameters.description: Describes the nature of the address location. See locationDescriptor

parameters.name: setBack
parameters.description: The distance to move the accessPoint away from the curb and towards the inside of the parcel (in metres). Ignored if locationDescriptor not set to accessPoint.

200.description: The site with the requested siteID in Site Address Representation

parameters.name: occupantID
parameters.description: Occupant identifier

parameters.name: outputFormat
parameters.description: Results format. See outputFormat

parameters.name: outputSRS
parameters.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

parameters.name: locationDescriptor
parameters.description: Describes the nature of the address location. See locationDescriptor

parameters.name: setBack
parameters.description: The distance to move the accessPoint away from the curb and towards the inside of the parcel (in metres). Ignored if locationDescriptor not set to accessPoint.

200.description: The occupant with the requested occupantID in Site Address Representation plus Occupant Representation

parameters.name: intersectionID
parameters.description: A unique intersection identifier

parameters.name: outputFormat
parameters.description: Results format. See outputFormat

parameters.name: outputSRS
parameters.description: The EPSG code of the spatial reference system (SRS) to use for output geometries. See outputSRS

200.description: The Intersection with the requested intersectionID in Intersection Address Representation
